Main Game Semalam Suntuk, Remaja Thailand Tewas
06 Nov 2019, 20:36 by Fitraya Ramadhanny - detikInet


Foto: Istimewa

Jakarta - Kecanduan game bisa berakibat fatal. Seorang remaja di Thailand tewas setelah main semalam suntuk.Tragedi ini menjadi pemberitaan media di Thailand dan sejumlah media di luar negeri. Korban adalah Piyawat Harikun (17) yang ditemukan tewas di meja komputernya di Udon Thani, Thailand.Piyawat memang sedang liburan tengah semester sampai akhir bulan Oktober. Dia mengisi waktunya dengan mengadu game online multiplayer dari PC di kamar rumahnya.Orangtuanya bukan tidak khawatir. Ayahnya, Jaranwit mengatakan sudah memperingatkan berkali-kali. Piyawat sering bergadang main game multiplayer. Makanan pun dia bawa ke dalam kamar.Sang ayah menemukan Piyawat pada Senin sore. Dia terjatuh dengan kursinya, tubuhnya rebah ke atas PC yang ditaruh di lantai.Ada tumpukan kotak makanan pesan antar dan botol minuman ringan. Headphone tergeletak di atas PC. Jaranwit mencoba membangunkan anaknya, tapi sia-sia."Saya panggil namanya dan bilang, 'bangun! bangun! Tapi dia tidak merespons. Saya lihat sudah meninggal," kata ayahnya berduka.Tim medis yang memeriksa menyebutkan korban tewas karena stroke akibat main games sepanjang malam. Jaranwit mengakui anaknya kecanduan game online. Dia berpesan lewat media, agar para orangtua menjaga anak mereka agar tidak kecanduan game."Saya ingin kematian anak saya menjadi contoh. Orangtua harus tegas dengan jam bermain game anaknya, atau bisa berakhir nasibnya seperti anak saya," tutupnya.Pada 2018, WHO secara resmi mengatakan kecanduan game adalah bentuk penyakit atau masalah kesehatan. Played Game Overnight, Thai Teenager Killed
06 Nov 2019, 20:36 by Fitraya Ramadhanny - detikInet


Photo: Special

Jakarta - Addiction to games can be fatal. A teenager in Thailand died after playing all night. This tragedy has become media coverage in Thailand and a number of overseas media. The victim is Piyawat Harikun (17) who was found dead on his computer desk in Udon Thani, Thailand. Pyawat is indeed on mid-semester holidays until the end of October. He fills his time by playing multiplayer online games from a PC in his room. His parents are not not worried. His father, Jaranwit, said he had warned many times. Piyawat often stays playing multiplayer games. He brought food to the room. Father found Piyawat on Monday afternoon. He fell with his chair, his body collapsed onto a PC that was placed on the floor. There was a pile of food delivery boxes and soft drink bottles. Headphones lying on the PC. Jaranwit tried to wake his child, but in vain. "I called his name and said, 'wake up! Wake up! But he did not respond. I see dead," said his father in mourning. The medical team examining said the victim died of a stroke due to playing games throughout night. Jaranwit admitted his son was addicted to online games. He advised through the media, that parents take care of their children so they are not addicted to the game. "I want the death of my child to be an example. Parents must be firm with hours of playing their children's games, or could end their fate like mine," he concluded. In 2018, WHO The official said game addiction is a form of disease or health problem. Beware! Check out the video "WHO Sets Game Addiction as Mental Disorder" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (fay / fay)
